      • buttonAlignment

        public final MonologFXBuilder buttonAlignment(MonologFX.ButtonAlignment ALIGNBUTTONS)
        Sets the button alignment for the MonologFX dialog box. Default is CENTER.
        Parameters:
        ALIGNBUTTONS - Valid values are LEFT, RIGHT, and CENTER.
        See Also:
        ButtonAlignment

      • message

        public final MonologFXBuilder message(java.lang.String MESSAGE)
        Sets the text displayed within the MonologFX dialog box. Word wrap ensures that all text is displayed.
        Parameters:
        MESSAGE - String variable containing the text to display.

      • modal

        public final MonologFXBuilder modal(boolean MODAL)
        Sets the modality of the MonologFX dialog box to build/display.
        Parameters:
        MODAL - Boolean. A true value = APPLICATION_MODAL, false = NONE.

      • titleText

        public final MonologFXBuilder titleText(java.lang.String TITLE_TEXT)
        Sets the text to be displayed in the title bar of the MonologFX dialog.
        Parameters:
        TITLE_TEXT - String containing the text to place in the title bar.

      • X

        public final MonologFXBuilder X(double X_COORD)
        Sets x coordinate of the MonologFX dialog (if centering is not desired).
        Parameters:
        X_COORD - Double representing the x coordinate to use for display.

      • Y

        public final MonologFXBuilder Y(double Y_COORD)
        Sets y coordinate of the MonologFX dialog (if centering is not desired).
        Parameters:
        Y_COORD - Double representing the y coordinate to use for display.

      • stylesheet

        public final MonologFXBuilder stylesheet(java.lang.String STYLESHEET)
        Allows developer to add stylesheet(s) for MonologFX dialog, supplementing or overriding existing styling.
        Parameters:
        STYLESHEET - String variable containing the path/name of the stylesheet to apply to the dialog's scene and contained controls.

      • build

        public MonologFX build()
        This is where the magic happens...or at least where it all comes together. :-) Returns a MonologFX dialog, ready to display with showDialog().
        Specified by:
        build in interface javafx.util.Builder<MonologFX>
        Returns:
        MonologFX A dialog.
